content:
To let agents send a question with dynamic options in enhanced Messaging channels or Messaging for In-App and Web, create a flow and associate it with your question component. Then, add the flow to the Service Console.

Available in: Lightning Experience.
This article applies to: 
Messaging for In-App, Messaging for Web, enhanced WhatsApp, enhanced Facebook Messenger, and enhanced Apple Messages for Business channels
USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To open, edit, or create a flow in Flow Builder: Manage Flow

In Flow Builder, create a screen flow. Create a Variable resource of data type Text, called recordId, and make it available for input. This resource stores the ID of the messaging session.
Add your own custom flow logic.
Add a Record Collection Variable and show a collection of records, select Allow multiple values (collection). The flow must populate the variable with the same object type that the messaging component needs.
Add a Get Records element and define conditions to get the records of interest.
Add a Screen flow component. Within that screen, add an Enhanced Message component.
For Messaging Session ID, enter the recordId Variable that you created in step 2.
Select the messaging component that you want to use.
For Record Variable, enter the Record Collection Variable described in step 3.
Save and activate the flow.
Add the flow to the Service Console so agents can send the component during messaging sessions.

See Add Messaging to the Service Console. Send the question with options in enhanced Messaging channels or Messaging for In-App and Web.
title: Setting Up Dynamic Messaging Components in Service Cloud
